The competition series will allow contestants as young as 12 to audition, a decision Simon Cowell defended on the call after being asked if kids that young should be subjects to public scrutiny. We've started to see a trend with kids this age and what they can do. I like the idea that a 12-year-old on this show can compete with an older singer... times have changed. You have to make a case-by-case decision based on them as a person. Contestants will have to audition before a live audience of 5,000 people in an arena. Eric Schmidt , who previously had been Novell CEO and Sun CTO, has been the public face of Google with his calm, relaxed demeanor, while running the company as a "triumvirate" with Page and Sergey Brin . Having Eric Schmidt as the front of Google has been tremendous for Google, and there is no doubt that bringing his perspective has been critical for good decision-making at the company, IDC analyst Al Hilwa said via e-mail. with more consequence than the muddled plan for postwar Iraq. The Defense Department pushed early on "to do what we'd done in Afghanistan"- where a tribal loya jirga had quickly anointed Hamid Karzai as leader. The goal was to move quickly to have an Iraqi face on the leadership in the country, as opposed to a foreign occupation. Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's early takeaway from NSC meetings was that "the president agreed." Yet Colin Powell 's State Department was adamantly opposed.
